blockDescription: Removes existing assemblies and modifies or integrates new work into existing structures.

questions.question: What is the first step before removing any existing material in a renovation project?

options.B: Identify and assess hazardous materials and structural conditions

explanations.A: Starting demolition without assessment is dangerous and may disturb hazardous materials
explanations.B: Before any demolition, a thorough assessment must identify hazardous materials (asbestos, lead, mold) and evaluate structural conditions to ensure safe removal
explanations.C: Fixtures can be removed but only after proper assessment is complete
explanations.D: Utilities must be identified and properly disconnected, but assessment comes first

questions.question: What is the purpose of installing temporary shoring during renovations?

options.B: To support loads when load-bearing elements are removed or modified

explanations.A: Shoring is structural support, not storage
explanations.B: Temporary shoring supports structural loads when load-bearing walls, beams, or other elements are being removed or altered during renovation
explanations.C: Work platforms serve a different purpose than structural shoring
explanations.D: Ventilation is unrelated to shoring purposes

questions.question: When was asbestos commonly used in building materials?

options.B: Between 1930 and 1990
options.D: Asbestos was never used in buildings

explanations.A: Asbestos use continued well beyond 1950
explanations.B: Asbestos was commonly used in various building materials from the 1930s through the 1990s in insulation, floor tiles, ceiling tiles, and other products
explanations.C: Asbestos use was largely banned by the 1990s
explanations.D: Asbestos was widely used in construction for decades

questions.subtask: G-22.01 Joins new to existing construction
questions.question: What is the primary challenge when joining new lumber to old lumber in renovations?

options.B: Different dimensions, moisture content, and wood species

explanations.A: While color may differ, structural compatibility is the primary concern
explanations.B: Old lumber often has different actual dimensions (true 2x4 vs. nominal), moisture content, species, and strength characteristics requiring careful planning for connections
explanations.C: Cost is a concern but not a technical challenge for joining
explanations.D: Significant technical challenges exist when joining new to old materials

questions.question: What material is commonly used to protect finished floors during renovation work?

options.B: Ram board, plywood, or heavy-duty protective sheeting

explanations.A: Newspaper provides insufficient protection from impacts and moisture
explanations.B: Ram board, plywood, or heavy-duty floor protection products provide adequate protection from impacts, scratches, and moisture during renovation
explanations.C: Plastic alone is slippery and doesn't protect from impacts
explanations.D: Floor protection is essential to prevent costly damage

questions.subtask: G-22.02 Changes existing structure during renovations
questions.question: What must be installed when removing a load-bearing wall?

options.B: A beam or header properly sized to carry the load

explanations.A: Removing a load-bearing wall without support will cause structural failure
explanations.B: A properly engineered beam or header must be installed to carry the loads previously supported by the wall, with adequate bearing at each end
explanations.C: Decorative columns alone typically lack structural capacity
explanations.D: Insulation doesn't provide structural support

questions.question: What PPE is essential when removing materials that may contain lead paint?

options.B: Safety glasses only
options.C: Respirator rated for lead, protective clothing, and gloves

explanations.A: Regular dust masks don't filter lead particles adequately
explanations.B: Eye protection alone is insufficient for lead exposure
explanations.C: Lead paint removal requires proper respirator (HEPA or P100), protective clothing to prevent dust accumulation, and gloves to prevent skin contact
explanations.D: PPE is mandatory when working with lead-containing materials

questions.question: What is the purpose of dust barriers during renovation?

options.B: To contain dust and debris within work area

explanations.A: Dust barriers serve a functional, not decorative purpose
explanations.B: Dust barriers (typically plastic sheeting with zippers) contain construction dust and debris within the work area, protecting occupied spaces and HVAC systems
explanations.C: While they may provide privacy, containment is the primary purpose
explanations.D: Light blocking is incidental to the primary containment function

questions.subtask: G-22.01 Joins new to existing construction
questions.question: How should new foundation be joined to existing foundation?

options.A: Simply pour concrete next to existing
options.B: Use dowels or rebar drilled into existing foundation with proper overlap and bonding agent

explanations.A: A cold joint without reinforcement will crack and separate
explanations.B: New concrete must be mechanically connected to existing using drilled and epoxied dowels or rebar, with bonding agents to ensure monolithic behavior
explanations.C: Stacking without connection creates a weak point prone to failure
explanations.D: Connection is essential for load transfer and preventing separation

questions.question: What is selective demolition?

options.B: Carefully removing specific materials while preserving surrounding areas

explanations.A: Complete demolition is not selective
explanations.B: Selective demolition carefully removes only designated materials while protecting adjacent areas, utilities, and structural elements that will remain
explanations.C: Random removal is not selective or controlled
explanations.D: Timing doesn't define selective demolition

questions.subtask: G-22.02 Changes existing structure during renovations
questions.question: What professional should be consulted before removing or modifying structural elements?

options.B: Structural engineer or architect

explanations.A: Real estate agents don't provide structural engineering services
explanations.B: Structural engineers or architects must evaluate and design solutions for structural modifications to ensure building safety and code compliance
explanations.C: Insurance agents handle coverage, not structural design
explanations.D: Professional consultation is required for structural changes

questions.question: How should HVAC systems be protected during dusty renovation work?

options.B: Cover or seal vents and consider shutting down system

explanations.A: Unprotected HVAC systems can distribute dust throughout the building
explanations.B: Vents should be sealed with plastic or filters, and the system may need to be shut down to prevent dust circulation and contamination
explanations.C: Running systems spreads dust and contaminates ductwork
explanations.D: Complete removal is excessive and expensive

questions.question: What is the safest method for removing old drywall?

options.B: Score, cut, and carefully remove sections

explanations.A: Random smashing creates excessive dust and debris, and may damage framing
explanations.B: Scoring seams, cutting manageable sections, and carefully removing them minimizes dust, protects framing, and allows inspection for hazards
explanations.C: Explosives are dangerous and inappropriate for residential demolition
explanations.D: This method is dangerous and damages surrounding structure

questions.subtask: G-22.01 Joins new to existing construction
questions.question: When adding a room addition, how should new framing be attached to existing structure?

options.B: Remove siding, expose framing, and properly connect new to existing framing members
options.D: Leave a gap between new and old

explanations.A: Nailing to siding doesn't provide adequate structural connection
explanations.B: Siding must be removed to expose structural framing, allowing proper connection of new framing to existing studs, plates, and headers
explanations.C: Adhesive alone is insufficient for structural connections
explanations.D: Gaps create thermal bridges and structural discontinuity

questions.question: What is the purpose of temporary weather protection during renovation?

options.B: To protect building interior and materials from weather damage

explanations.A: Weather protection serves a functional, not aesthetic purpose
explanations.B: Temporary tarps, plastic sheeting, or weather barriers protect the building interior, materials, and work from rain, snow, and wind damage
explanations.C: Privacy is incidental to weather protection
explanations.D: Shade is a minor benefit, not the primary purpose

questions.subtask: G-22.02 Changes existing structure during renovations
questions.question: What is sistering a joist?

options.A: Installing a second joist alongside an existing one for reinforcement
options.B: Removing every other joist
options.D: Connecting joists perpendicular to each other

explanations.A: Sistering involves attaching a new joist alongside a damaged or undersized existing joist to increase strength and load capacity
explanations.B: Removing joists reduces strength
explanations.C: Painting is unrelated to sistering
explanations.D: This describes blocking or bridging, not sistering

questions.question: How should plaster walls be removed?

options.A: Wet down to reduce dust, then carefully break and remove sections
options.B: Dry demolition with no dust control

explanations.A: Wetting plaster reduces dust generation, then careful sectional removal minimizes mess while protecting lath and framing that may remain
explanations.B: Dry plaster demolition creates excessive hazardous dust
explanations.C: Plaster can be safely removed when needed
explanations.D: Pressure washing creates excessive mess and water damage

questions.question: What should be done to protect windows during construction?

options.B: Cover with plywood, cardboard, or protective film

explanations.A: Unprotected windows are easily damaged by debris and materials
explanations.B: Plywood covers, heavy cardboard, or protective film shields windows from scratches, impacts, and overspray during construction
explanations.C: Window removal is expensive and usually unnecessary
explanations.D: Paint doesn't protect from physical damage

questions.subtask: G-22.01 Joins new to existing construction
questions.question: When adding new roofing, how should it be integrated with existing roof?

options.A: Lay new shingles over old without integration
options.B: Properly flash and weave new roofing into existing, following manufacturer guidelines
options.C: Leave a gap between old and new

explanations.A: Simply overlaying without integration creates leak paths
explanations.B: New roofing must be properly integrated using flashing, weaving techniques, or valley methods to ensure waterproof transitions per manufacturer specifications
explanations.C: Gaps will leak water
explanations.D: Duct tape is not a roofing material

questions.question: What is the recommended approach for removing load-bearing walls?

options.B: Install temporary support, then remove wall after permanent beam is ready
options.C: Remove half the wall at a time

explanations.A: Immediate removal without support will cause structural collapse
explanations.B: Temporary shoring must support loads, then the wall can be removed and replaced with a properly sized permanent beam or header
explanations.C: Partial removal without shoring is still dangerous
explanations.D: Load-bearing walls require careful engineered removal process

questions.subtask: G-22.02 Changes existing structure during renovations
questions.question: What is underpinning?

options.B: Strengthening or deepening existing foundations

explanations.A: Painting is not underpinning
explanations.B: Underpinning is the process of strengthening or extending existing foundations, often to support additional loads or repair settlement issues
explanations.C: Removal is not underpinning
explanations.D: Decorative work is not underpinning

questions.question: How should existing finished cabinets be protected during nearby renovation work?

options.B: Cover with plastic sheeting or protective padding

explanations.A: Unprotected cabinets will be damaged by dust, debris, and impacts
explanations.B: Plastic sheeting and padding protect cabinets from dust, scratches, and impacts while allowing them to remain in place
explanations.C: While removal is an option, in-place protection is usually more practical
explanations.D: Paint doesn't protect from physical damage

questions.question: What precaution should be taken when removing old flooring?

options.B: Test for asbestos in vinyl flooring and adhesives, especially pre-1990

explanations.A: Removing without testing may disturb hazardous materials
explanations.B: Old vinyl flooring, backing, and adhesives may contain asbestos; testing is required before removal, especially in buildings constructed before 1990
explanations.C: Burning creates toxic fumes
explanations.D: Flooding creates unnecessary water damage

questions.subtask: G-22.01 Joins new to existing construction
questions.question: When tying new concrete to existing, what surface preparation is required?

options.B: Clean, roughen surface, and apply bonding agent
options.C: Simply pour new concrete against old

explanations.A: Unprepared surfaces won't bond properly
explanations.B: Existing concrete must be cleaned, roughened (scarified), and coated with bonding agent to ensure new concrete bonds properly and acts monolithically
explanations.C: Pouring against unprepared surface creates a weak cold joint
explanations.D: Oil prevents bonding

questions.question: What is the purpose of negative air pressure systems in renovation containment?

options.B: To prevent dust and contaminants from spreading to other areas

explanations.A: Cooling is not the primary purpose of negative pressure
explanations.B: Negative air machines with HEPA filters exhaust air from the work area, creating lower pressure that prevents dust and contaminants from escaping to adjacent spaces
explanations.C: Negative air systems don't heat space
explanations.D: Noise is incidental, not the purpose

questions.subtask: G-22.02 Changes existing structure during renovations
questions.question: What is balloon framing and why is it important to identify in renovations?

options.B: Old framing method with continuous studs from foundation to roof, creating fire hazards

explanations.A: Balloon framing has nothing to do with actual balloons
explanations.B: Balloon framing (pre-1950s) has continuous wall studs creating open cavities from basement to attic, allowing rapid fire spread; must be identified and fire-blocked during renovation
explanations.C: Walls are not inflatable
explanations.D: Platform framing is different and newer than balloon framing

questions.question: How should ceramic tile be removed from walls?

options.A: Use hammer and chisel carefully, protecting underlying surfaces
options.B: Blast with high-pressure water

explanations.A: Careful chiseling breaks tile and mortar while minimizing damage to substrate, which may be preserved depending on condition
explanations.B: High pressure water creates excessive mess without effectively removing set tile
explanations.C: Torches don't remove tile and may cause fire
explanations.D: Tile can be removed when needed

questions.question: What method is used to protect stairs during construction?

options.B: Cover treads with protective material secured in place

explanations.A: While sometimes necessary, protected stairs can often remain in use
explanations.B: Ram board, carpet remnants, or protective sheeting secured to treads protects stairs while allowing continued use during construction
explanations.C: Stair removal is extreme and impractical
explanations.D: Paint doesn't protect from physical damage

questions.subtask: G-22.01 Joins new to existing construction
questions.question: When adding new electrical service, how should it be integrated with existing?

options.B: Coordinate with electrician to properly integrate, meet code, and ensure adequate capacity

explanations.A: Separate systems are inefficient and may not meet code
explanations.B: Licensed electricians must evaluate existing capacity, integrate new circuits properly, ensure code compliance, and coordinate with carpenter for openings and backing
explanations.C: Random connections are dangerous and illegal
explanations.D: Electrical work requires licensed electricians

questions.question: What information should be documented before demolition begins?

options.B: Photos, dimensions, material types, and conditions of existing structure

explanations.A: Documentation is essential for multiple reasons
explanations.B: Photos and documentation of existing conditions protect against damage claims, assist with planning, and provide reference for reconstruction
explanations.C: Worker names alone don't document existing conditions
explanations.D: Date alone is insufficient documentation

questions.subtask: G-22.02 Changes existing structure during renovations
questions.question: What is the minimum bearing length required when installing a new beam?

options.C: 89 mm (3-1/2 in.) or as specified by engineer

explanations.A: This bearing length is insufficient for beam loads
explanations.B: Still inadequate for typical beam bearing
explanations.C: Beams typically require minimum 89 mm (3-1/2 in.) bearing, though engineer specifications may require more based on loads and conditions
explanations.D: Adequate bearing is critical for beam support

questions.question: How should adjacent properties be protected during renovation?

options.B: Notify neighbors, install barriers, control dust, and prevent debris migration
options.C: Only protect if complaints are received
options.D: Protection is not the contractor's responsibility

explanations.A: Neighbors have rights to protection from construction impacts
explanations.B: Professional practice includes notification, dust barriers, construction fencing, and measures to prevent debris, dust, and damage to adjacent properties
explanations.C: Proactive protection prevents complaints and damage
explanations.D: Contractors are responsible for protecting adjacent properties

questions.question: What is the proper procedure for removing old insulation?

options.B: Test for asbestos or vermiculite, use proper PPE, and contain during removal

explanations.A: Testing is required to identify hazards
explanations.B: Old insulation may contain asbestos or contaminated vermiculite; testing, proper respirators, containment, and specialized disposal are required
explanations.C: Household vacuums spread contamination; HEPA vacuums are required
explanations.D: Burning creates toxic fumes

questions.subtask: G-22.01 Joins new to existing construction
questions.question: How should new drywall be joined to existing plaster walls?

options.B: Install transition strips or molding to accommodate different thicknesses and materials

explanations.A: Direct butt joints crack due to different materials and thicknesses
explanations.B: Transition strips, reveals, or molding accommodate thickness differences and material properties while creating professional-looking joints
explanations.C: Large gaps look unprofessional and don't seal properly
explanations.D: Drywall and plaster can be successfully joined with proper technique

questions.question: What is the purpose of shoring existing structure before creating new openings?

options.B: To prevent structural collapse by supporting loads during opening creation

explanations.A: Shoring serves critical structural purposes
explanations.B: Temporary shoring must support structural loads when cutting through walls, floors, or roofs to prevent collapse during the opening creation process
explanations.C: Work platforms are different from structural shoring
explanations.D: Shoring is often essential for safety

questions.subtask: G-22.02 Changes existing structure during renovations
questions.question: What is jacking in renovation work?

options.B: Lifting sagging floors or roofs with hydraulic jacks to restore level

explanations.A: This describes theft, not construction technique
explanations.B: Jacking uses hydraulic jacks and temporary posts to gradually lift sagging structural elements, allowing repair or reinforcement of supports
explanations.C: Car jacks are for temporary lifting, not permanent installation
explanations.D: Jacking is structural work, not finish work

questions.question: How should old nails and fasteners be handled during demolition?

options.B: Remove or bend over to prevent injuries

explanations.A: Protruding nails create serious puncture wound hazards
explanations.B: All exposed nails and fasteners should be removed or bent over flush to prevent injuries during handling and disposal of materials
explanations.C: Ignoring fasteners creates safety hazards
explanations.D: Paint doesn't eliminate the puncture hazard

questions.question: What protection is needed for existing landscaping during renovation?

options.B: Fence off areas, protect tree roots, and prevent equipment damage
options.D: Landscape protection is not carpenter's concern

explanations.A: Landscaping is valuable and easily damaged
explanations.B: Temporary fencing, tree root protection barriers, and equipment restrictions protect existing landscaping from compaction, damage, and contamination
explanations.C: Removal is expensive and unnecessary with proper protection
explanations.D: All trades share responsibility for site protection

questions.subtask: G-22.01 Joins new to existing construction
questions.question: How should new framing be attached to existing concrete walls?

options.B: Use appropriate concrete anchors, powder-actuated fasteners, or expansion bolts

explanations.A: Regular nails cannot penetrate concrete adequately
explanations.B: Proper concrete attachment requires concrete anchors, powder-actuated fasteners, or expansion bolts rated for the loads
explanations.C: Adhesive alone is insufficient for structural attachment
explanations.D: Positive mechanical fastening is essential

questions.question: What should be done with construction debris and waste materials?

options.B: Sort for recycling, proper disposal, and hazardous waste handling according to regulations

explanations.A: Accumulated debris creates safety hazards
explanations.B: Materials should be sorted for recycling where possible, disposed of properly at approved facilities, and hazardous materials handled according to regulations
explanations.C: Burning is illegal, dangerous, and environmentally harmful
explanations.D: Illegal dumping violates environmental regulations

questions.subtask: G-22.02 Changes existing structure during renovations
questions.question: What is the purpose of a structural engineer's stamp on renovation plans?

options.B: Indicates professional engineering approval that structural changes meet code and safety requirements

explanations.A: Engineering stamps have legal significance
explanations.B: An engineer's stamp certifies that structural modifications have been properly designed to meet building codes and safety standards
explanations.C: While adding cost, engineering is necessary for safety and code compliance
explanations.D: Stamps serve critical legal and safety purposes

questions.question: How should utilities be managed during renovation?

options.B: Identify, protect, and shut off utilities in work areas with proper coordination

explanations.A: Active utilities in demolition areas create serious hazards
explanations.B: All utilities must be identified, properly shut off where needed, protected in place, and coordinated with utility companies and licensed trades
explanations.C: Cutting without verification is extremely dangerous
explanations.D: Ignoring utilities causes injury and damage

questions.subtask: G-22.01 Joins new to existing construction
questions.question: When extending existing rafters or joists, what connection method is typically used?

options.B: Scarf joint or splice with properly engineered connection

explanations.A: Simple butt joints lack adequate strength
explanations.B: Extensions require scarf joints or splice plates with bolts or nails in an engineered pattern to transfer loads properly
explanations.C: Tape has no structural capacity
explanations.D: Proper connection is essential for load transfer

questions.question: What is soft stripping in demolition?

options.B: Removing non-structural elements like fixtures, finishes, and equipment before structural demolition

explanations.A: Wallpaper removal is just one small part
explanations.B: Soft stripping is the removal of non-structural elements (fixtures, doors, cabinets, finishes) before structural demolition begins
explanations.C: Soft stripping is a phase, not a level of demolition
explanations.D: Tool type doesn't define soft stripping

questions.question: What is the purpose of covering openings during multi-day renovations?

options.B: To secure site, prevent weather damage, and deter unauthorized entry

explanations.A: Opening protection serves important functional purposes
explanations.B: Temporary covering of door and window openings protects from weather, provides security, and prevents accidents during non-working hours
explanations.C: While it may conceal work, security and protection are primary
explanations.D: Opening protection is essential for site safety

questions.subtask: G-22.02 Changes existing structure during renovations
questions.question: What must be considered when cutting floor joists for new stairs or openings?

options.B: Proper headers and trimmers must be installed to carry interrupted loads
options.D: Floor joists can never be cut

explanations.A: Cutting without support causes floor failure
explanations.B: When joists are cut, doubled headers and trimmers must be installed to carry the loads from interrupted joists, similar to new construction framing
explanations.C: Random cutting without compensation compromises structure
explanations.D: Joists can be cut with proper engineering and support

questions.question: How should mold-affected materials be handled during removal?

options.B: Contain area, use PPE, wet materials during removal, and dispose properly

explanations.A: Mold exposure creates health hazards
explanations.B: Mold remediation requires containment, proper respirators, wetting materials to reduce spore release, and disposal in sealed bags
explanations.C: Paint doesn't eliminate mold
explanations.D: Mold must be remediated for health and structural reasons

questions.subtask: G-22.01 Joins new to existing construction
questions.question: When adding new siding over existing, what must be verified?

options.B: Wall plane, moisture barriers, and compatibility with existing assembly

explanations.A: Multiple factors must be verified for proper installation
explanations.B: Wall plane must be verified, proper moisture barriers ensured, and new siding must be compatible with existing wall assembly and ventilation
explanations.C: Color is aesthetic; structural and moisture issues are critical
explanations.D: Cost doesn't ensure proper installation

questions.question: What is the purpose of using protective coatings on nearby surfaces during painting or finishing?

options.B: To prevent overspray and protect from damage

explanations.A: Protection doesn't change color of protected surfaces
explanations.B: Masking and protective films prevent paint overspray, stains, and damage to surfaces not being finished
explanations.C: Adhesion improvement is for surfaces being finished, not protected
explanations.D: Protection prevents costly damage

questions.question: What is the safest way to remove abandoned wiring?

options.B: Have licensed electrician verify power is off, then remove according to code

explanations.A: Random cutting may electrocute workers
explanations.B: Licensed electricians must verify circuits are de-energized and properly disconnected before wiring removal
explanations.C: This method is dangerous and damages structure
explanations.D: While sometimes left, removal may be necessary and must be done safely

questions.subtask: G-22.02 Changes existing structure during renovations
questions.question: What is required when converting an attic to living space?

options.B: Structural evaluation, proper stairs, adequate headroom, insulation, and ventilation per code

explanations.A: Attic conversions have extensive code requirements
explanations.B: Converting attics requires structural evaluation for floor loads, proper egress stairs, minimum 2.3m headroom, insulation, HVAC, and proper ventilation
explanations.C: Flooring alone doesn't meet code for habitable space
explanations.D: Paint is cosmetic; structural and safety issues must be addressed

questions.question: How should existing hardwood floors be protected?

options.B: Multiple layers: protective film, ram board, and plywood for traffic areas

explanations.A: Unprotected hardwood will be damaged
explanations.B: Hardwood requires layered protection: protective film on floor, ram board over that, and plywood walkways in high-traffic areas
explanations.C: Plastic alone doesn't prevent impact damage
explanations.D: Wet mopping doesn't protect from construction damage

questions.subtask: G-22.01 Joins new to existing construction
questions.question: When adding insulation to existing walls, what must be considered?

options.B: Vapor barriers, ventilation, electrical considerations, and fire blocking
options.D: Insulation is never added to existing walls

explanations.A: Simply filling cavities may create moisture and fire hazards
explanations.B: Existing wall insulation must consider vapor barrier placement, ventilation needs, electrical box protection, and fire blocking requirements
explanations.C: R-value is one factor but not the only consideration
explanations.D: Insulation can be added with proper techniques

questions.question: What documentation is required for hazardous material disposal?

options.B: Manifests tracking material type, quantity, transport, and disposal location

explanations.A: Hazardous waste requires extensive documentation
explanations.B: Hazardous materials require manifests that track materials from generation through transport to approved disposal, maintaining chain of custody
explanations.C: Receipts alone don't meet regulatory requirements
explanations.D: Written documentation is legally required

questions.question: What is the purpose of temporary bracing during renovation?

options.B: To stabilize structure when permanent bracing is compromised

explanations.A: Bracing serves critical structural purposes
explanations.B: Temporary bracing prevents collapse when walls, sheathing, or other structural bracing elements are removed during renovation
explanations.C: Bracing is structural, not for storage
explanations.D: Marking is incidental to structural support

questions.subtask: G-22.02 Changes existing structure during renovations
questions.question: What is required when lowering a basement floor?

options.B: Structural engineering for underpinning, waterproofing, and foundation stability

explanations.A: Digging below foundations undermines them dangerously
explanations.B: Lowering basement floors requires engineered underpinning to maintain foundation support, waterproofing systems, and careful excavation to prevent collapse
explanations.C: Foundation walls must be maintained or replaced, not removed
explanations.D: Extensive engineering and precautions are required

questions.question: How should old window units be removed?

options.B: Remove interior stops, carefully extract unit, protect opening

explanations.A: Smashing damages surrounding structure
explanations.B: Removing interior stops allows careful window extraction while protecting the rough opening and exterior finish for new window installation
explanations.C: Cutting through wall creates unnecessary damage
explanations.D: Windows can be replaced during renovation

questions.subtask: G-22.01 Joins new to existing construction
questions.question: When matching new trim to existing historic trim, what approach is recommended?

options.B: Custom mill or purchase historically accurate profiles matching existing
options.D: Paint all trim to hide differences

explanations.A: Modern profiles often don't match historic details
explanations.B: Historic renovations require custom-milled or specially sourced trim profiles that match existing historic details for seamless integration
explanations.C: New trim is often necessary for additions or repairs
explanations.D: Paint doesn't hide profile differences

questions.question: What fire safety measures are required during renovation?

options.B: Working smoke detectors, fire extinguishers, hot work permits, and clear egress

explanations.A: Renovations create elevated fire risks
explanations.B: Fire safety requires maintained detection systems, appropriate fire extinguishers, permits for hot work, and clear emergency egress paths
explanations.C: One extinguisher is insufficient for most renovation sites
explanations.D: Fire safety is critical during renovation

questions.question: What is the best practice for removing carpeting?

options.B: Cut into manageable sections, remove tack strips carefully, protect subfloor

explanations.A: Random removal is inefficient and messy
explanations.B: Cutting carpet into sections facilitates handling, careful tack strip removal prevents subfloor damage, and protection prevents damage during removal
explanations.C: Burning creates toxic fumes and fire hazard
explanations.D: Covering doesn't remove the old carpet

questions.subtask: G-22.02 Changes existing structure during renovations
questions.question: What is required when cutting through roof structure for a skylight?

options.B: Headers and trimmers to support interrupted rafters or trusses per engineering

explanations.A: Cutting without support compromises roof structure
explanations.B: Skylight openings require proper headers and trimmers to carry loads from cut rafters or special truss modifications per manufacturer
explanations.C: Reinforcement is essential for structural integrity
explanations.D: Skylights are permitted with proper engineering

questions.question: How should appliances and fixtures be protected during nearby work?

options.B: Cover with protective materials and cardboard, disconnect if necessary

explanations.A: Unprotected appliances are easily damaged
explanations.B: Appliances and fixtures should be covered with cardboard and protective materials, and disconnected if work is extensive or poses risks
explanations.C: Removal is often unnecessary with proper protection
explanations.D: Contractor is responsible for protecting client's property

questions.subtask: G-22.01 Joins new to existing construction
questions.question: When connecting new ductwork to existing HVAC, what must be coordinated?

options.B: System capacity, proper sealing, insulation, and balancing with HVAC contractor

explanations.A: Extensive coordination is required
explanations.B: HVAC contractors must verify system capacity, ensure proper connections, sealing, insulation, and balance airflow for new additions
explanations.C: Random connections create inefficient or failed systems
explanations.D: HVAC work requires licensed contractors

questions.question: What should be checked before removing any wall?

options.B: Whether wall is load-bearing, location of utilities, and presence of hazardous materials

explanations.A: Color is irrelevant to safe removal
explanations.B: Assessment must determine if wall is load-bearing, locate utilities within the wall, and identify any hazardous materials before removal
explanations.C: Thorough assessment is essential for safety
explanations.D: Technical factors override preferences

questions.question: What is the purpose of sealing work areas from occupied spaces?

options.B: To control dust, noise, and maintain indoor air quality in occupied areas

explanations.A: Sealing serves important health and comfort purposes
explanations.B: Sealing work areas with plastic barriers and zipper doors prevents dust migration, reduces noise transmission, and maintains livable conditions in occupied spaces
explanations.C: Quality work doesn't need hiding
explanations.D: Sealing is essential for occupied renovations

questions.subtask: G-22.02 Changes existing structure during renovations
questions.question: What is required when reinforcing existing foundations?

options.B: Engineering design, proper excavation, reinforcement integration, and curing

explanations.A: Simply adding concrete may not bond or provide needed reinforcement
explanations.B: Foundation reinforcement requires engineering design, careful excavation, proper cleaning and bonding of existing foundation, reinforcement placement, and proper curing
explanations.C: Foundations can be reinforced with proper techniques
explanations.D: Paint provides no structural reinforcement

questions.question: How should vermiculite insulation be handled?

options.B: Test for asbestos contamination, use certified contractors if present

explanations.A: Vermiculite may contain asbestos contamination
explanations.B: Vermiculite, especially Zonolite brand, may contain asbestos; testing is required and removal must be by certified contractors if contaminated
explanations.C: Contaminated vermiculite should be removed
explanations.D: Regular vacuums spread contamination

questions.subtask: G-22.01 Joins new to existing construction
questions.question: When extending plumbing in renovations, what must be coordinated?

options.B: System capacity, proper venting, code compliance, and slope with plumber

explanations.A: Extensive coordination is essential
explanations.B: Licensed plumbers must verify system capacity, ensure proper venting, maintain required slopes, and meet all code requirements for extensions
explanations.C: Random connections violate code and create problems
explanations.D: Plumbing requires licensed plumbers

questions.question: What access considerations are important during occupied renovations?

options.B: Maintain safe access routes, mark hazards, and coordinate work hours
options.C: Allow unrestricted access to work areas

explanations.A: Occupants need safe access to their spaces
explanations.B: Safe, clearly marked access routes must be maintained, hazards identified, and work scheduled to minimize disruption while maintaining safety
explanations.C: Work areas must be restricted for safety
explanations.D: Access management is critical during occupied renovations

questions.question: What is the proper method for disposing of old paint cans?

options.B: Take to hazardous waste facility or follow local disposal regulations

explanations.A: Paint is often considered hazardous waste
explanations.B: Paint and paint cans should be taken to hazardous waste collection facilities or disposed of according to local regulations
explanations.C: Paint disposal in drains is illegal and harmful
explanations.D: Burning paint creates toxic fumes

questions.subtask: G-22.02 Changes existing structure during renovations
questions.question: What is required when increasing floor loads in renovation?

options.B: Structural evaluation and reinforcement of floors, beams, and foundations as needed
options.D: Floor load increases are not possible

explanations.A: Increasing loads requires structural assessment
explanations.B: Engineers must evaluate existing capacity and design reinforcement of floor systems, supporting beams, and foundations to safely carry increased loads
explanations.C: Flooring alone doesn't increase structural capacity
explanations.D: Loads can be increased with proper reinforcement

questions.question: How should electrical panels and meters be protected during work?

options.B: Barrier protection preventing contact while maintaining access for emergency shutdown

explanations.A: Electrical equipment needs protection
explanations.B: Panels need barrier protection from dust and impacts while maintaining clear access for emergency shutoffs and required clearances
explanations.C: Complete covering violates code clearance requirements
explanations.D: Moving panels is expensive and often impractical

questions.subtask: G-22.01 Joins new to existing construction
questions.question: When matching new brick to existing, what must be considered?

options.B: Size, color, texture, mortar composition, and bonding pattern

explanations.A: Size alone doesn't ensure proper match
explanations.B: Matching brick requires considering size, color, texture, absorption rate, mortar type and color, and bonding pattern for visual and structural compatibility
explanations.C: Mortar alone doesn't match brickwork
explanations.D: Brick can be matched with careful selection

questions.question: What precaution is necessary when removing walls near plumbing stacks?

options.B: Identify and protect plumbing, coordinate with plumber for any modifications
options.D: Plumbing is not affected by wall removal

explanations.A: Plumbing damage creates costly problems
explanations.B: Plumbing stacks must be identified, protected during demolition, and any required modifications coordinated with licensed plumbers
explanations.C: Cutting plumbing causes flooding and code violations
explanations.D: Plumbing is frequently affected by wall removal

questions.question: What is the purpose of daily site cleanup during renovation?

options.B: To maintain safety, prevent accidents, and show professionalism
options.D: Cleanup is not necessary during work

explanations.A: Cleanup serves important safety purposes
explanations.B: Daily cleanup removes trip hazards, controls dust, prevents accidents, maintains professional appearance, and protects completed work
explanations.C: While inspectors appreciate it, safety is the primary reason
explanations.D: Regular cleanup is essential for safety

questions.subtask: G-22.02 Changes existing structure during renovations
questions.question: What is scabbing in structural reinforcement?

options.B: Adding reinforcing members alongside damaged structural elements

explanations.A: Scabbing is a construction technique, not a disease
explanations.B: Scabbing involves attaching new structural members alongside damaged ones to restore or increase load capacity
explanations.C: Removal is not scabbing
explanations.D: This describes finishing, not structural work

questions.subtask: G-22.01 Joins new to existing construction
questions.question: When adding new exterior doors, how should they be flashed with existing walls?

options.B: Integrate flashing with existing water barriers following proper sequencing

explanations.A: Flashing is essential for water protection
explanations.B: New door flashing must integrate with existing weather barriers in proper sequence (sill, sides, head) to create continuous water protection
explanations.C: Caulk alone is insufficient for water management
explanations.D: Intentional gaps without flashing allow water infiltration

questions.question: How should valuable or irreplaceable items be handled during renovation?

options.B: Recommend removal to secure location or provide special protection

explanations.A: Valuable items are at risk during construction
explanations.B: Best practice recommends removal of valuables to secure locations; if remaining on-site, special protection and documentation are warranted
explanations.C: While liability is limited, professionals should recommend appropriate protection
explanations.D: Single layer protection is insufficient for valuables

questions.subtask: G-22.02 Changes existing structure during renovations
questions.question: What must be maintained when removing interior walls in multi-story buildings?

options.B: Fire separations, structural support, and code-required compartmentation
options.D: Walls can all be removed freely

explanations.A: Multi-story buildings have critical code requirements
explanations.B: Fire separations between units and floors, structural support for upper levels, and required compartmentation must be maintained or properly compensated
explanations.C: Code compliance is mandatory, not just aesthetic
explanations.D: Many walls serve critical code and structural functions

questions.question: What final inspection should occur after demolition work?

options.B: Verify complete removal, check for damage to remaining structure, and ensure safety for next phase

explanations.A: Post-demolition inspection is essential
explanations.B: Final inspection verifies complete removal per scope, assesses any damage to remaining elements requiring repair, and confirms site safety for construction phases
explanations.C: Debris removal is one aspect but not complete
explanations.D: Inspection must be comprehensive, not limited to materials
